settings.title: Precious Metals
settings.content: Choosing a precious metal can be a confusing part of the engagement ring process. Learn about appearance, durability, and price of the available precious metal options here at MG.
Considered to be non-toxic and hypoallergenic, platinum is a precious metal with a naturel beautiful silvery-white color.
settings.content1:
18K gold is the least likely to tarnish and is the most expensive gold
choice for jewelry. 18K has a lighter and more intense appearance.
settings.content2: 14K is the most common gold used in the US. While very close in color, 14K will not be as rich and vivid as 18K gold.
settings.content3: 10K has a lower gold content so it may tarnish quicker than 14K or 18K.

settings.content: Unlike gold, platinum doesnâ€™t require as much maintenance. Platinum wears down at a much slower rate and does not tarnish.
settings.content1: Since 18K is a purer form of gold, it is softer than 14K and 10K. It will require more maintenance than other metals.
settings.content2: 14K gold is made up of 58.3% pure gold making it a stronger metal. This purity is best for delicate rings.
settings.content3: 10K gold is that hardest metal out of the other options because of its lower gold content and higher other metal mixture.

settings.content: Platinum is the typically the priciest out of the precious metals. Platinum is denser than gold, so platinum jewelry will usually weigh more than other precious metals.
settings.content1: Being that 18K contains 75% gold, it is more expensive than 10K and 14K gold.
settings.content2: 14K is more affordable than platinum and 18K gold. 14K has more metal other metal content than 18K giving it a lower price point.
settings.content3: 10K is the most affordable / least expensive metal option. 10K contains 41.7% pure gold and is mixed with other metals such as silver or nickel.

settings.title: Recycled precious metals
settings.content:
Precious Metal mining has a large negative impact on our environment.
Metal mining has a long history of below minimum wages, civil wars, and
devastating impacts on the environment. Our jewelry is mostly crafted
with recycled and re-refined precious metals.
Platinum is considered the best of the best. It is pure, rare, and naturally white. There is no better choice to show your unlimited love and commitment.
18K has a richer and more intense color than 14K. Top choice for more simplistic designs and styles.
Most popular due to its durability, 14k is less expensive and more scratch resistant. 14K is the top option for people who have active jobs and use their hands actively.
Most durable and great value, this option is best for active lifestyles and for those on a budget. 10K is least expensive precious metal for jewelry.
